title: Personality Trait System
description:
Add random personality traits assigned at birth that affect stat decay rates and action bonuses. Makes every pet unique and creates replayability.

**Trait Categories:**
- Temperament: Calm (slower decay) vs Hyperactive (faster energy drain, more play rewards)
- Appetite: Picky (smaller feed bonus) vs Hungry (larger bonus, faster hunger decay)
- Sociability: Independent (slower happiness decay) vs Needy (bonus from frequent care)
- Constitution: Robust (resists illness) vs Fragile (gets sick easier)

**Implementation:**
- Add Trait struct with Name and Modifiers map (stat_name -> multiplier)
- Add Traits []Trait field to Pet struct
- Create generateTraits() to randomly select one trait per category
- Create getEffectiveDecayRate() to apply trait modifiers to base rates
- Update decay calculations in loadState() and updateHourlyStats()
- Update action methods (feed, play) to apply trait bonuses
- Update illness chance calculation to use constitution trait
- Display traits in UI stats view

**Complexity:** Medium
**Impact:** High - creates unique pets and replayability

title: Autonomous Pet Behavior System
description:
Give the pet agency with auto-sleep/wake, action refusal, random moods, and attention-seeking behavior. Transform the pet from passive stat-tracker to something that feels alive.

**Features:**
- Auto-sleep when Energy < 20 (drowsy warning at < 40)
- Auto-wake after 6-8 hours of sleep when Energy is restored
- Refuse actions: won't play when too tired, won't eat when full
- Random moods: playful, lazy, needy (affects behavior and status emoji)
- Attention seeking: status emoji shows what pet wants (üçñ hungry, üéæ wants play)

**Implementation:**
- Add Mood, MoodExpiresAt, AutoSleepTime fields to Pet struct
- Create applyAutonomousBehavior() called in loadState()
- Update action methods (feed, play) to check conditions and refuse if inappropriate
- Update status emoji logic to reflect moods and desires

**Complexity:** Medium
**Impact:** Very High - makes pet feel alive instead of passive
